Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bac5(3-25) (Synthetic AMPs, Pro-rich, PrAMPs, Arg-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid truncation, bovin cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (80%) toOaBac5miniR: 26%, P: 48%, I: 13%.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli BW25113 or ATCC 25922 (MIC 4-8 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 19606 (MIC 8 uM), S-enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC >64 uM), K-pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC >64 uM), P-aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC > 64 uM), and S-aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC > 64 uM). bactericidal, MBC generally 4-fold higher.SAR: the N-terminal RF is important for killing S. enterica.MOA:bacteria: It is inactive against E. coli after deletion of the sbmA gene that encodes a protein transporter to internalize the peptide to inhibit ribosome synthesis. This applies to the entire peptide series herein.
Literature Information.Author: Mardirossian M, Sola R, Degasperi M, Scocchi M.2019
Literature Information.Title: Search for Shorter Portions of the Proline-Rich Antimicrobial Peptide Fragment Bac5(1-25) That Retain Antimicrobial Activity by Blocking Protein Synthesis.
